direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve stopping or shutting down operations, particularly related to network access and transaction management.
Both methods involve canceling ongoing transactions, which is a key part of shutting down the system.
Both methods involve expiring or terminating transactions, which is a critical step in shutting down the system.
Both methods involve cleaning up listeners or handlers, which is part of the shutdown process to ensure no lingering operations.
Both methods involve handling events or messages, though in different contexts (shutdown vs. event processing).
Both methods involve sending responses or handling transactions, though in different phases (shutdown vs. active operation).
Both methods involve sending requests or handling transactions, though in different phases (shutdown vs. active operation).
Both methods involve managing sockets, though in different contexts (shutdown vs. setup).
